Working With brms

Source: vignettes/brms.Rmd
brms.Rmd
library(shredder)
library(brms)

Generate Data

group <- rep(c("treat", "placebo"),
             each = 30)

symptom_post <- c(
  rnorm(30, mean = 1, sd = 2),
  rnorm(30, mean = 0, sd = 1)
)

dat1 <- data.frame(group, symptom_post)

Run Model

fit <- brm(bf(symptom_post ~ group, sigma ~ group),
           data = dat1,
           family = gaussian(),
           seed = 1234)
 Family: gaussian 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = log 
Formula: symptom_post ~ group 
         sigma ~ group
   Data: dat1 (Number of observations: 60) 
Samples: 4 chains, each with iter = 2000; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup samples = 4000

Population-Level Effects: 
                 Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI    Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
Intercept         0.17415   0.21411 -0.24522  0.60092 1.00044     4472     2757
sigma_Intercept   0.15059   0.13548 -0.09732  0.43226 1.00114     3380     2654
grouptreat        0.77871   0.43330 -0.09195  1.63554 1.00028     3302     3038
sigma_grouptreat  0.55265   0.18776  0.18724  0.92137 1.00014     3572     3035

Samples were drawn using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Bulk_ESS
and Tail_ESS are effective sample size measures, and Rhat is the potential
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
fit%>%
  plot(N = 2, ask = FALSE)

Select first 100 Posterior Samples from each Chain

fit_slice <- fit%>%stan_slice(1:100)
 Family: gaussian 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = log 
Formula: symptom_post ~ group 
         sigma ~ group
   Data: dat1 (Number of observations: 60) 
Samples: 4 chains, each with iter = 1100; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup samples = 400

Population-Level Effects: 
                 Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI    Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
Intercept         0.17798   0.21733 -0.23143  0.61644 0.99496      559      281
sigma_Intercept   0.16153   0.14008 -0.08664  0.44255 1.00642      340      312
grouptreat        0.79581   0.42865 -0.07975  1.72775 1.00952      399      278
sigma_grouptreat  0.54691   0.20280  0.16129  0.94159 1.00901      362      322

Samples were drawn using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Bulk_ESS
and Tail_ESS are effective sample size measures, and Rhat is the potential
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
fit_slice%>%
  plot(N = 2, ask = FALSE)

Thin 25% of Posterior Samples from each Chain

fit_thin <- fit%>%
  stan_thin_frac(0.25)
 Family: gaussian 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = log 
Formula: symptom_post ~ group 
         sigma ~ group
   Data: dat1 (Number of observations: 60) 
Samples: 4 chains, each with iter = 1250; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup samples = 1000

Population-Level Effects: 
                 Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI    Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
Intercept         0.18322   0.21295 -0.23079  0.61640 0.99898      938      878
sigma_Intercept   0.14669   0.13553 -0.09745  0.44037 1.00199      995      951
grouptreat        0.76236   0.41928 -0.04918  1.53724 1.00383     1005     1033
sigma_grouptreat  0.55463   0.18821  0.18981  0.92421 0.99903     1018     1021

Samples were drawn using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Bulk_ESS
and Tail_ESS are effective sample size measures, and Rhat is the potential
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
fit_thin%>%
  plot(N = 2, ask = FALSE)

Filter Posterior Samples by Conditional

fit_filter <- fit%>%
  stan_filter(b_grouptreat>=1)
 Family: gaussian 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = log 
Formula: symptom_post ~ group 
         sigma ~ group
   Data: dat1 (Number of observations: 60) 
Samples: 4 chains, each with iter = 1299; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup samples = 1196

Population-Level Effects: 
                 Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI    Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
Intercept         0.06531   0.19522 -0.34464  0.43697 0.99985     1044      962
sigma_Intercept   0.14361   0.13711 -0.10582  0.43979 1.00271      934      874
grouptreat        1.26848   0.22910  1.00835  1.82646 1.00179     1082     1188
sigma_grouptreat  0.56196   0.19330  0.18842  0.93814 1.00020      718      914

Samples were drawn using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Bulk_ESS
and Tail_ESS are effective sample size measures, and Rhat is the potential
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
fit_filter%>%
  plot(N = 2, ask = FALSE)

Filter Posterior Samples by Conditional Subset Chain

fit_filter_chain <- fit%>%
  stan_filter(b_grouptreat>=1)%>%
  stan_retain(chains = 1)
 Family: gaussian 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = log 
Formula: symptom_post ~ group 
         sigma ~ group
   Data: dat1 (Number of observations: 60) 
Samples: 1 chains, each with iter = 1299; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup samples = 299

Population-Level Effects: 
                 Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI    Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
Intercept         0.04682   0.20150 -0.38450  0.45456 0.99845      210      202
sigma_Intercept   0.15895   0.14196 -0.09463  0.47973 1.00101      166      222
grouptreat        1.30194   0.24984  1.00749  1.85111 0.99712      278      265
sigma_grouptreat  0.54823   0.20641  0.16413  0.93358 0.99892      170      242

Samples were drawn using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Bulk_ESS
and Tail_ESS are effective sample size measures, and Rhat is the potential
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
fit_filter_chain%>%
  plot(N = 2, ask = FALSE)
